meanings.definition: A band of strong tissue connecting bones or cartilages at a joint.
meanings.sent1: The ligaments in my knee help keep my bones together.
meanings.sent2: Doctors often have to repair torn ligaments in athletes.
meanings.sent3: The ligaments in the puzzle were the key to solving it.
meanings.sent4: Her friendship acted like the ligaments that held our group together.
meanings.sent5: The ligaments in the bridge were crucial for its stability.

meanings.definition: A sheet or band of tough fibrous tissue connecting bones or cartilages at a joint or supporting an organ.
meanings.sent1: The ligaments in his back supported his spine.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon carefully reattached the torn ligaments.
meanings.sent3: The ligaments of the story connected all the characters.
meanings.sent4: The ligaments of trust between them were strong.
meanings.sent5: The ligaments in the tree branches held the weight of the swing.
